title: Freeze-frame: When in India, how to roam like a local
text:
WHERE : Puri, Odisha. Juhu, Mumbai 
POPULAR FOR : Religious gatherings. Local fests. Many visitors who come to India seek spiritual learnings. The city of Puri in Odisha receives many during Rath Yatra. Puri is also known as Jagannath Puri after the 11th-century Jagannath Temple located in the city. It is one of the original Char Dham pilgrimage sites, of which the other legs are Dwaraka, Badrinath and Rameswaram. According to Hindu teachings, a pilgrimage of the temples of India is not considered complete without a journey to Puri.

Iskcon Movement: A tourists sports a saree and bindi and sings Lord Jagannath hymns in Puri, Odisha. 
WHERE: Hampi (Karnataka) 
POPULAR FOR: Temples and heritage ruins of Vijayanagara empire.
Aquaint village in northern Karnataka, India, Hampi was one of the richest and largest cities in the world during its prime. It is located within the ruins of the city of Vijayanagara, the former capital of the Vijayanagara Empire. Having connection with the city of Vijayanagara, Hampi continues to be an important religious centre, housing the Virupaksha Temple and several monuments belonging to the old city. The ruins are a UNESCO World Heritage Site, listed as the Group of Monuments at Hampi. According to statistics of 2014, Hampi is the most searched historical place in Karnataka on search engine Google.
This UNESCO heritage site attracts scores of foreign tourists. 
WHERE: Jaipur (Rajasthan) 
POPULAR FOR: Folk art forms, palaces, rich cuisine and shopping.
Jaipur has been boastful of foreign tourists for many years now. And truly, many make their way during the best time to visit this place, which is between October to March. Since the weather is pleasant during these months, that allows one to explore more of this place without getting scorched in the seething heat. This city of Rajputs is well known for its fairs and fests that are held on a grand level. The festivals include Kite Festival, Camel Festival, Teej, Gangaur, Elephant Festival etc. The city witnesses maximum tourists during these days. Join in!

Local dancers in Jaipur and Udaipur invite tourists to shake a leg on Indian beats.
